channel.title: Port Forwarding - Netgear WGR614v9
channel.description:
[b]1)[/b] Okay, so first of all, I followed the guide located here word-for-word: [u][i][url=http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Netgear/WGR614v9/Runescape_Private_Server.htm]http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Netgear/WGR614v9/Runescape_Private_Server.htm[/url][/i][/u]
[b]2)[/b] Now second of all, my Default Gateway IP is not 192.168.x.x, it's 172.16.x.x.
[b]3)[/b] And finally, I downloaded PFPortChecker (by PortForward.com), and when I enter the port [b]43594[/b], and click "Check Me", it gets my External IP address fine, and even pings my router, but I keep getting this message as the result; Your port is NOT OPEN or not reachable!
As for my firewall, I have already turned it off completely.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/N9sDq.png[/img]
Now, does anyone know what I did wrong at all? :/

item.title: Port Forwarding - Netgear WGR614v9
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

I don’t need to know them, I just assume that you are using the wrong ips to host add me on skype: Oceannomic

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding - Netgear WGR614v9
item.dc:creator: @readicant readicant
item.description:
@readicant wrote:

[quote=“ultimatepkvillage, post:6, topic:435164”][quote author=readicant link=topic=537884.msg3933914#msg3933914 date=1330902150]

[size=14pt]2) Now second of all, my Default Gateway IP is not 192.168.x.x, it’s -----> 172.16.x.x.<------
[/size]

N9sDq.png747×230

Now, does anyone know what I did wrong at all?
[/quote]

Nope and are you sure you using the IPV4 Address from the cmd and not the default gateway? because the information you provided looks like you are trying to use the default gateway address[/quote]

Sorry for the confusion, but my gateway is: 172.16.0.1
Now, the IP I’m using is: 172.16.0.4, which is the internal IP of my laptop.

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding - Netgear WGR614v9
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

[quote=“readicant, post:1, topic:435164”][size=14pt]2) Now second of all, my Default Gateway IP is not 192.168.x.x, it’s -----> 172.16.x.x.<------
[/size]

N9sDq.png747×230

Now, does anyone know what I did wrong at all? :/[/quote]

Nope and are you sure you using the IPV4 Address from the cmd and not the default gateway? because the information you provided looks like you are trying to use the default gateway address

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding - Netgear WGR614v9
item.dc:creator: @readicant readicant
item.description:
@readicant wrote:

ultimatepkvillage:

use the IPV4 address for the ip and see if that works

That’s what I’ve been using. Am I suppose to use something else…?

Read full topic

item.title: Port Forwarding - Netgear WGR614v9
item.dc:creator: @readicant readicant
item.description:
@readicant wrote:

[quote=“Skiire, post:2, topic:435164”]When I portforwarded on a Netgear router I had to use a range of ports in order for it to allow incoming connections.

EG:

Start Port End Port
43593 43595[/quote]

Still nothing…

Read full topic

item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

When I portforwarded on a Netgear router I had to use a range of ports in order for it to allow incoming connections.

EG:

Start Port End Port
43593 43595

item.title: Port Forwarding - Netgear WGR614v9
item.dc:creator: @readicant readicant
item.description:
@readicant wrote:

1) Okay, so first of all, I followed the guide located here word-for-word:
http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/Netgear/WGR614v9/Runescape_Private_Server.htm

2) Now second of all, my Default Gateway IP is not 192.168.x.x, it’s 172.16.x.x.

3) And finally, I downloaded PFPortChecker (by PortForward.com), and when I enter the port 43594, and click “Check Me”, it gets my External IP address fine, and even pings my router, but I keep getting this message as the result; Your port is NOT OPEN or not reachable!

As for my firewall, I have already turned it off completely.

N9sDq.png747×230

Now, does anyone know what I did wrong at all?

Read full topic
